page.title: 05Moorlands Kennels,Condover.
page.content: The Kennels used to be Condover Railway Station.The last train ran on the lines in 1961.When Mr.and Mrs. Austin bought the Station,there was no electricity.In the garden there was a 60 feet deep well that was used by the engines. In 1970 they started the Kennels.Up to 16 cats and 40 dogs can stay for up to 6 months at a cost of Â£2 a night. The cats are kept in cages in a little hut.They don't put cats together in case they fight but dogs may share.The cats have to have stone hot water bottles in case they burst them and similarly dogs are not allowed bean bags to sleep on for the same reason. In 1980 Mrs.Austin judged the Sky Terriers at Crufts.She also breeds Sky Terriers and had a champion dog called Highland Fling which won 'Best of Breed' at Crufts.
